file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-18-07-04 - SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR EXTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR EXTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the external actuating handle of the side- hinged main door. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE- SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR EXTERNAL 52-18-07-000-801-A HINGED MAIN DOOR ACTUATING HANDLE - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE- SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR EXTERNAL 52-18-07-400-801-A HINGED MAIN DOOR ACTUATING HANDLE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-18-07 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-18-07-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR 2. SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR EXTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the external actuating handle of the side- hinged main door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-04-000-801-A/400 MAIN-DOOR LINING PANEL - REMOVAL SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR ACTUATING CAM - RE- AMM TASK 52-18-01-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the side-hinged main door available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Side-hinged main door I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the side-hinged main door. (2) Remove the lining panel of the side-hinged main door ( AMM TASK 25-23-04-000-801- A/400). (3) Put and keep the internal actuating handle in the closed position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-18-07 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A CAUTION:DO NOT MOVE THE INTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE AND DO NOT CHANGE THE ADJUSTMENT OF THE END ROD WHILE YOU PERFORM THIS TASK. REFER TO SHEET 1 FIGURE 401. (1) Remove the torque tube. Refer to AMM TASK 52-18-01-000-801-A/400. (2) Remove the cotter pin (1), nut (2), washer (3), and bolt (5) to disconnect the rod (4) from the bellcrank (19). (3) Remove the nut (7), washer (6), and bolt (20) from the bellcrank (19). (4) Remove the bellcrank (19) from the shaft (12). (5) Remove the spring (18) from the lever (13). (6) Remove the nut (17), washer (16), and bolt (15), and then remove the cam (14). (7) From the external side of the aircraft, remove the nut (9), washer (10), and bolt (8) from the external handle (11). (8) Remove the external handle. (9) If necessary, disassemble the external handle as follows (refer to sheet 2): (a) Slowly remove the nut (24), bushing (35), and screw (34) to disconnect the spring (33) and external handle stop (21) from the external handle (29). (b) If applicable, remove the cotter pin (27), washer (28), and pin (30) from the external handle (29). (c) If necessary, remove the shims (25) and (32), and bushings (26) and (31) from the external handle (29). (d) If necessary, remove the bushings (22) and (36) from the external handle stop (21). (10) If you will replace the bearing (37), use a puller to remove the old one. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-18-07 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR External Actuating Handle - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 1 ZONE 811 A B DET. A 9. NUT 10. WASHER 1. COTTER PIN 2. NUT 3. WASHER 4. ROD 8. BOLT 5. BOLT 11. EXTERNAL HANDLE 6. WASHER TORQUE 7. NUT TUBE (REF.) 37. BEARING 13. LEVER 20. BOLT 19. BELLCRANK 12. SHAFT 14. CAM DOOR STRUCTURE (REF.) 15. BOLT 18. SPRING DET. B 17. NUT 16. WASHER EM145AMM520218B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-18-07 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. BUSHING FWD 22. BUSHING 23. BUSHING 35. BUSHING 34. SCREW 1 DET. A 24. SPECIAL NUT 33. SPRING 25. SHIM 32. SHIM 26. BUSHING 27. COTTER 31. BUSHING PIN 30. PIN 28. WASHER 29. EXTERNAL DET. B HANDLE 1 SPECIAL SIX-SPLINE, SELF-LOCKING, NUT (WITH WASHER). 145AMM520206.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-18-07 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-18-07-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR 3. SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR EXTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the external actuating handle of the side- hinged main door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-18-00/1 AMM TASK 25-23-04-400-801-A/400 MAIN-DOOR LINING PANEL - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 52-18-00-820-801-A/500 MAIN-DOOR INTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE - TEST SIDE-HINGED MAIN-DOOR ACTUATING CAM - IN- AMM TASK 52-18-01-400-801-A/400 STALLATION MAIN DOOR - ACTUATING AND LOCKING MECHA- IPC 52-11-00 NISM SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the side-hinged main door available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pin IPC 52-11-00 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Side-hinged main door EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-18-07 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) If necessary, install a new bearing (37) wet with sealant P/S870C-12 (SRM 51-20-01) and with a hand-operated press. CAUTION:DO NOT MOVE THE INTERNAL ACTUATING HANDLE AND DO NOT CHANGE THE ADJUSTMENT OF THE END ROD WHILE YOU PERFORM THIS TASK. REFER TO SHEET 1 FIGURE 401. (2) Put the external handle on the shaft of the external handle. (3) Install the bolt (8), washer (10), and nut (9) to attach the external handle. (4) Install the torque tube. Refer to AMM TASK 52-18-01-400-801-A/400. (5) If the external handle was disassembled, assemble it again as follows (refer to sheet 2): (a) Put he external handle stop (21) on the external handle (29). (b) Put the spring (33) between the external handle stop (21) and external handle (29). (c) Install the screw (34), bushings (35) and (23), and nut (24) to attach the external handle (29) and external handle stop (21). (6) Put the cam (14) on the shaft (12). (7) Install the nut (17), washer (16), and bolt (15) to attach the cam (14) to the shaft (12). (8) Put the spring (18) on the lever (13) and connect the lever to the support of the door structure. (9) Put the bellcrank (19) on the shaft (12). (10) Install the nut (7), washer (6), and bolt (20) to attach the bellcrank (19) to the shaft (12). (11) Put the rod (4) on the bellcrank (19). (12) Install the bolt (5), washer (3), nut (2), and cotter pin (1) to connect the rod (4) and bellcrank (19). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do an operational check of the main door (AMM TASK 52-18-00-820-801-A/500). (2) Install the lining panels of the side-hinged main door ( AMM TASK 25-23-04-400-801- A/400). (3) Close the main door (AMM SDS 52-18-00/1).
